You are given a tree with $n$ vertices. Each leaf (end node) of the tree has a number of apples associated with it. The weight of a subtree is the sum of the apples in all the leaves of that subtree.

A tree is balanced if for every vertex, the weight of each of its subtrees is equal.

Find the minimum number of apples you need to remove from the tree to make it balanced. 


You can remove apples from any leaf.

You have a tree-shaped structure with numbered leaves, each containing a number of apples.  The goal is to find the fewest apples you need to remove from the leaves so that the total number of apples in each branch of the tree is the same.
